description:
Reminiscent of days gone by, we were walking around one night after getting drinks when we stumbled upon Creperie Saint Germain. It was open, so, let's get a crepe!

We got a Nutella + Strawberry to share, and dang was it good! If you're craving a crepe and it's getting late, this is your place! (I definitely sang that last line like a jingle in my head...)
author: Nic Z.

description:
Great place for a night snack!

They're open late... I believe we went around 10-11pm while we were getting a little buzzed from hanging out at Natoma Cabana. 

We got the salmon crepe and man, was it crispy. Haven't had such a crispy crepe in a long time. They had avocadoes in it which was such a plus! I love avocado. $10 for majority of their savory crepes, but ours was $12. Come by if you're feeling late night munchies or if you just want a little snack.
author: Lyra C.

description:
I remember when I went to Paris and ordered a Nutella & Strawberry crepe. It was packed with both ingredients and was well worth the price. Saint Germain, on the other hand, was a tad bit stingy with their ingredients and were over priced in my opinion. My crepe was super skinny and was lacking in berries. 

It hit the spot late at night. (Hence the 3 stars) It just wasn't worth the price.
author: Love K.

description:
We gave this place a try mainly because everything else was closed at 2am...

We had a Spicy Sausage ($10.50) and a Roasted Turkey ($10.50). The turkey meant felt more like ham...I was not into the cubed presentation. I wanted the Spicy Curried Chicken but they were out of chicken.

The food was fine; nothing special. I was not blown away by anything, but it satisfied my munchies. I didn't feel stuffed after eating it so that was good. 

I think I'm more of a dessert crepe type person so perhaps I will give their sweet crepes a try next time.
author: Alice L.

description:
My fav' crepes in SF. Cute little spot with a clean/clearcut menu! 

The hours vary so be sure to check online they're open and running! My faves are their dessert crepes. I love the strawberries, bananas, and nutella with whipped cream. Delicious!

Kind and quick service too. Check 'em out!
author: Carina M.

description:
All in all it was alright. Also not a fan of buckwheat crepes. It was like 3 AM and with limited food options we defaulted here, never been the biggest fan of crepes but it wasn't all that bad. I got a braised beef crepe that came with guac and my friend got a breakfast crepe with andouille sausage. Overall the crepes were pretty flavorful but the mixes just weren't exactly my favorite. I think that betting of sweet crepes is a better choice, going savory was not the best.

But overall the man working the crepe stand had a very positive attitude even at 4 AM. I was happy to try this joint before I left SF. Wouldn't exactly return on a daily basis, but possibly in the future for dessert.
author: Michael C.

description:
Such a cute and local spot to walk to at 2am when you're feeling hungry! 

I think the quality for the crepes are good, but it was a bit overpriced. These are more like a snack rather than something that would fill you up. If there were more ingredients, I think I'd definitely be worth the price. 

There was only one guy in front of me that ordered one crepe but for some reason, the order took long to make. Didn't enjoy waiting in the freezing cold.
author: April O.

description:
Awesome catering service. We had crepes at our office and it was very organized. They brought about 6 people to help make and serve the crepes. They also use fresh ingredients! Avocados, green onions, tomatoes, etc. With the choice of either savory or sweet crepes. Both are fairly good. Well portioned. Feel free to add whatever you like!

Definitely looking forward to another crepe day from this crew.
author: Justin L.

description:
You can see Creperie Saint Germain around town, whether at their food truck or at events that they're catering. Crepes like the spicy sausage are reasonably good, although in my opinion lacking a bit in filling, and the disappointment compounds itself when you remember how much you paid for it - anywhere from $8 to $10 each, last time I visited. Even if the ingredients are fresh and top-notch, the whole equation just didn't sing for me.

If you're out and about and you're either pressed for time or have too little readily available options near you, then this isn't a bad fall-back.
author: Vincent L.

description: Fast service, fresh and savory crepes! They've got an awesome variety of menu items to choose from - sweet, savory, whatever you want! Definitely give this food truck a chance if you happen to walk past it!
author: Alyssa N.

description:
Sometime you just need to indulge, and to satisfy you need both savory and sweet. I ordered the roasted turkey, which had the correct combo of flavors with pesto, spinach, avocado...just a great twist of flavors. I also got the s'mores crepe and added strawberries. The strawberries were a must because they added a bit of juice to each bite, otherwise it got a little dry...so definitely recommend this addition. Also, I was pleased that the s'more was offered in dark chocolate, as I am a fan, and I think it would have been ruined. 
The crepes are a bit pricey at over $10 bucks a piece, especially since there is some competition in the area at a $7-$8 range. Also, depending on when you come, the wait can be long, because they are made one at a time, and if person before you has ordered multiple for their office, it could be awhile! However, I was pleased to say it was definitely worth the wait, as everything was well executed.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Getting a crepe at Creperie Saint Germain is always so convenient as I work right across the street from the street cart on 2nd and Howard. 

I usually get the breakfast crepe or the chicken apple sausage option made into a crepe. Both very delicious! the service is always quick and friendly! 

I tend to not go here too often though. It is a special treat when I do. It is about $10 a crepe so if you are trying to not spend a lot of money on food, this would not be the best place. It is worth the $10 but may seem a bit overpriced to some.
author: Michael T.

description:
It is a food truck, so not a sit down resteraunt. When you group versus other food trucks, it is really good. Fast service, good variety, people were nice, and food was good.
Thought food flavors were well done, we had group of four, everyone was happy. 
Only critique I would give is drink selection was poor.
author: Dan S.

description: It's ok.. partly my fault my husband doesn't like mustard and the Cuban has a lot of mustard on it that I didn't read(my fault). The Nutella crepe was 7.5 plus 1.5 plus 1 for banana which I thought was pricy for what you get. I got the bacon breakfast crepe all was good except the bacon the bacon had a lot of fat grizzle which I am not a fan of. The guy that took our order was super nice though! Price point is high for the quality.
author: Tahvooche S.

description:
Perfect little crepes in a perfect little cart.

Creperie Saint Germain is a hard to find cart on a busy corner where sweet and savory crepes appear like magic.  Whether you want lunch or dessert, you can pick up from an array of sandwich like filled crepes to sweet crepes filled with fruit, chocolate, and Nutella.  There is a very simplistic pleasure into eating crepes and Creperie gives you that pleasure with the convenience of street food.

A great place for a Crepe on the go.  Definitely worth your time if you're a crepe fan!
author: Nadav P.

description:
After you are done with clubbing at Temple, this the go to place for munchies! They have a wide selection of sweet and savory crepes and is opened pretty late! Lines are pretty long after everyone start getting out of the club. My favorite all time crepe is the Braised Beef crepe! It has braised beef, avocado, jalapeño, swiss cheese, tomato, green onion. SUPER good and portions are great. The beef is tender and the jalapeño gives it an awesome kick. The crepe is buckwheat, so at least you are feeling somewhat healthy. 

Overall, great places for late munchies!
author: Natalie L.

description:
This is a permanent food truck at the corner on 2nd and Howard, just across from the LinkedIn office. They feature a wide variety of sweet and savory crepes, and the savory crepes are just large enough to make a meal. I personally enjoy the chicken and mushroom crepe, and usually add an egg to top it off (eggs make every meal better).

There's a certain charm that comes with standing outside of a food truck ordering a crepe, though I've always personally felt like the window is a little too high (maybe I'm just short). My coworker calls it "requesting a crepe from the crepe gods" due to the towering height of the window.

There's sometimes a little bit of a wait, but it's never been more than 5-10 minutes. Since it's a truck, there isn't any seating, but if you walk across the street there's a nice public open space in the first floor of the LinkedIn building where you can hang out.

The prices used to be a lower, but now most crepes are in the $10 range, putting this in the standard price range for the area (as opposed to cheap, which was previously a distinguishing factor for this place).

Great place to grab breakfast, lunch, or a late-afternoon snack -- in other words, visit anytime to satisfy your crepe craving!
author: Brittany C.

description:
Generally, I don't like standing in line for any sort of food truck in the Financial District. I'm not a very patient person, and I don't like waiting when it's cold outside. However, my colleague and I were meeting up for lunch. She chose Creperie Saint Germain and was convinced that there was indoor seating, so I donned my coat and scarf and indulged her. Fortunately there was not much of a line, so ordering was quick.

To be honest, I was skeptical about this place, but I was totally blown out of the water by the excellent customer service and substantial food serving size. I ordered a savory shredded beef crepe to-go, and it was surprisingly heavy when I got it. My colleague and I ate back at our coworking space, and I couldn't even finish the whole crepe. It was filling and satisfying. Now I'm curious about the other sweet and savory crepes. It's on 2nd and Howard, which is a great location. If you're looking to enjoy a tasty and relatively light and easy lunch, check it out. You can't miss this bright red food truck!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
$7.50 for a buckwheat crepe with turkey+tomatoes+mushrooms, and a few pieces of spinach for garnish. 

While tasty (though how much more tasty can 1 crepe get over another?), I'm still hungry.... 

4 stars because it's cheap, and fits my picky eating habits. 

Tips:
- limited menu (no salads)
- accepts credit card
- yelp 24 order ahead during certain hours only
- no place to sit down
- no boxes, only cones so you have to walk your crepe to your office
author: Kristie C.

description:
Solid little crepe truck right next to the LinkedIn building!  I've never liked savory crepes, so this review is for the sweet crepe!

I was craving a snack at 3 pm in SF FiDi, and I was eager to try this place!  I ordered the lemon curd crepe, which is basically just jam on the crepe.  Yum!  Definitely thought the lemon was delicious, as it complemented well with the special crepe batter they use.  I also believe the jam is homemade too, which is an added bonus to eating more authentic foods.

The service is really quick in the afternoon, and they made my crepe fresh to order!  No complaints about that. :)

I'm happy there's this option in FiDi, so I'm definitely coming back again!  Also, because I ate my crepe so fast I forgot to take a picture... :'(
author: Jana L.

description:
Most shameful visit ever (yes, EVER!!) to an eatery. I ordered a salted caramel crepe. It consisted of a singular buckwheat crepe and a drizzle of salted caramel sauce, heated over a pan for 30 seconds. I literally didn't taste the caramel sauce, and finished it in 5 small bites. $6.52 after taxes. It may be considered cheap for SF standard. Even with that in mind, you're better off getting $6.52 worth of food from 7/11, Safeway, or somewhere that is NOT here. Do not waste your time here. 

The location is in a pretty convenient spot. It seems like a lot of the reviewers talk about how it is a sweet place to grab a quick bite after a night out. If you choose to do so, I suggest you come to this place drunk. That's the only way I can see myself being happy about the product.
author: Min Ju L.

description:
Went here in the morning before work and wanted to try it. I love smoke salmon and wanted to try their savory smoked salmon crepe with mixed greens, crapers and green onion (and no cheese), it was disappointing.

The crepe is not freshly made, so it was more dough then crispy. I like capers, but i felt like a whole bottle was throw in and the mixed greens due to the crepe was mushy in the center.
author: Mei L.

description:
I've walked by this little creperie many times on my way to work and I've always been drawn to the delicious smells. I finally went there for lunch and tried one and it was pretty dang good. 

I got a Nutella crepe with strawberries for something like $6.50, which I believe is a great price for a fresh crepe. It comes in this adorable little handheld triangle, which I adored. The crepe itself was a yummy little treat. 

My one complaint would be that there aren't enough sweet crepe options, but I enjoyed walking through San Francisco eating this little warm slice of heaven.
author: Chelsea N.

description:
Wanted to love this little crepe stand but they gave me the wrong order, and then insisted that I said the wrong order instead of apologizing (my co-workers unanimously heard me order correctly). Additionally, the limited staff means a long wait time for the food to come out, especially during peak lunch hours.

The buckwheat crepe itself was good and I won't fault for them for quality, but the whole experience was unpleasant and I probably won't return.
author: Valerie L.

description: Great nutella crepe, just a tad expensive.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Creperie Saint Germain is a nice foodtruck with lovely crepes. You have a good variety of salty and sweet options. I went for one with smoked salmon, cream cheese, capers, green onions and mixed greens. It was a light and lovely crepe which was perfect for lunch.
Unfortunately there weren't any benches in the neighbourhood, so we took our crepes to the office and enjoyed them over there.
author: Vincent V.

description: Stopped here on my lunch the other day. The truck is decorated cute with a wide variety of sweet and savory crepes to offer. I went with the Roasted Turkey because I love pine nuts. It took her a few minutes to make and it was bigger than I expected. It included cheddar cheese, avocado, pine nuts, spinach, and pesto sauce. It was scrumptious! My favorite part was of course the pine nuts and the pesto. It ended up being two meals for me. (:
author: Nicole H.

description:
I was so excited to see that this little crepe food truck was right by the hotel I was staying at! What a perfect way to start off the morning.

The only reason I wouldn't give this place five stars is because the truck ran out of strawberries AND bananas, which was uber disappointing when I was really craving a sweet crepe with Nutella and fruits. Also, how could they NOT stock up with fruit in the morning? However, the worker was extremely kind and let me customize my own crepe with cheddar cheese, egg, and ham. And it was only $7! No tax!

The crepe was SO good. The egg was cooked into the crepe itself, so the flavor was spread evenly. But, I wish the ham was spread more evenly because there was literally nothing in the top and an overload in the bottom half. Still amazing though!

I also appreciated how quickly I got my crepe - I barely had to wait at all. And it came in a big box to keep it warm, as well as a wrapping around the crepe so that your hands don't get dirty while eating. It's the little things that count.

I will be back - hopefully there's strawberries and bananas next time!
author: Lauren V.

description:
I'm from France, so I know I can be picky about my crepes. I expected so much more from here though. 

The people were friendly but my crepe was just bad. The ham tasted undercooked and they burnt the crepe itself. Also, my pet peeve with crepes is when they only put the goods in the middle and that means tons of outside parts are straight crepe with no goodies. 

Just really disappointed. Won't go here again. If you know a good crepe, you shouldn't waste time here.
author: Michelle W.

description: I really wanted to like this place but the chicken with béchamel sauce was tasteless. There was crispy fresh spinach that looked great but it wasn't enough to make the crepe overall. The sauce tasted like it came out of a can. No line and fast service but maybe that isn't a good thing at noon. Apparently everyone else avoided it while all the other local take out places have lines.
author: Rose K.

description:
Fresh crepes...get your fresh crepes here! 

Whenever I take a work trip to SF I usually vacillate my lunch choices between super healthy kale-like salads to heart-attack inducing Chinese type eats. So, when Creperie Saint Germain offered an in between, I was pretty jazzed. 

I took my lunch party across the street to the crepe mobile, we ordered up and waited patiently for our surely delicious crepes to be created. I went with the #10 which features loads of veggies (I recall caramelized onions, spinach, and sun dried tomatoes) with cheese all folded into a perfect buckwheat crepe. It was the best I could do to imitate a healthy-ish lunch without making a full salad commitment. 

The crepe was filling and delicious (and maybe, just maybe a bit nutritious) and thus Creperie Saint Germain now sits in my top five quick lunch spots when I visit our HQ in SF.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Really unimpressed with this place. Maybe I'm spoiled by my local favorite, Crepes A Go-Go, but the quality of CSG is just poor.

I ordered 2 crepes, in keeping with my less-than-sober appetite. The smoked salmon was on the nose, overwhelmed by capers, while the sausage crepe's sausage had the consistency of a hot dog.

The crepe wrap itself wasn't pleasant either - a bit overcooked which covered up whatever flavor it might have had. I give it 2 stars rather than 1 because: they're open late, and they serve crepes.
author: Ben W.

description: Good place to grab lunch or late night crepes after the bars close.
author: Ioannis K.

description: A cute little food truck parked at Howard and 2nd. It's perfect for the afternoon sweet or savory snack.
author: Lindsay L.

description: We were looking desperately for some yummy food at 1am, so glad we found this gem!! Their #12 (braised beef, avocado, green onions and jalapeno) crepe was sooo good that I'm still thinking about it now!
author: Carol Y.

description:
Unfortunately they ran out of avocados today - so I switched my order from beef to chicken, and per usual, it was quite delectable. Other than the number 4 (aka. chicken), I've had the eggplant, salmon and nutella. It's a nice truck to stop by for lunch; the line isn't usually too long and crepes are so beautiful. I have always been fascinated by the casual spinach leaves sprinkled on top of the crepes, detached from the melted cheese and other ingredients wrinkled in the thin crispy wrap. They seem so free and independent, yet are an integral part of the crepe. 

Try a crepe here and think about the free-spirited spinach leaves. It'll make your day from just OK to quite alright.
author: Juliana P.

description:
I love cheese, egg, avocado and tomato in any form (breakfast sandwich, scramble, etc) and crepes are a delightful carrier, too. 

I do bring people here for lunch, but I find it hit or miss on the quick service side. Lunch rushes happen in this neighborhood, and sometimes they're prepared... And sometimes they really aren't. To be fair, they're honest when it's going to take a while and crepes are hard to scale for quick service, but still. Not my first choice if I'm in a hurry. 

The food's good-- likely not a 100% authentic Parisian street food experience, but a solid lunch stop when it's not crazy.
author: Krista L.

description:
A creperie should have buckwheat dough for savory crepes and a classic one for sweet ones. Here the dough is the same, not good and super thick ... which is no good for a crepe. 

The prices are very high for the quantity (7.50 for a sweet crepe?).  

Service is no good either. There are other creperies in the area that have way better quality and quantity. Pass this one.
author: Margaux M.

description:
I've been on the hunt for the best food trucks in SoMa and this is one of them. 

It's close to work, decently priced, and makes a wonderful breakfast or mid-afternoon treat. I've noticed the best crepes are served in the morning, so I usually go on my way to work. The buckwheat crepe batter is also gluten-free (and smells so good!).

I usually gravitate toward the sweet options, so nutella has to be included. A nutella, banana, and strawberry crepe hits the spot every time. I've also heard the savory ones are great, so I'll have to break my sweet preference next time.
author: Shira W.

description: I really really want to like this place, but the crepe was just "meh" to me. The whole concept is great, especially with being located across the street from a club and being open till 3am... However, the crepe lacked flavor. I got the honey almond dessert crepe and really could have done without the entire dessert. Not much flavor at all, and for the price, certainly not worth it. Glad I gave it a try, but might not be back.
author: Brie R.

description:
I don't understand why or how this place does enough business to stay here. Their standards are just high enough to appease the young, dumb, & drunk-hungry crowd I guess. 
*They don't even follow a set amount of business hours
*The people working there seem to have problems remembering to add key ingredients 
*The price is pretty steep considering what you get.
I mean wow, I could have made 8 of the #22 she gave me for $6. All she gave me was chopped strawberries in a wrap! Nothing else!! 
I live in the area and I've been coming here for a bit. It's going downhill quick.
author: Jackie K.

description:
I really wanted to have a go-to creperie near my apartment, but I have to say I was disappointed by Creperie Saint Germain. The dessert crepe was very mediocre, and the ingredients were not impressive. 

Also, note that their hours are indeed quite confusing. The hours are exactly the opposite for weekdays and weekends.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: i ordered the smoked turkey crepe for lunch and it tasted amazing! i'm a huge fan of caramelized onions and turkey, so this was perfect for me. there was enough flavoring to the crepe so it didn't taste dry. but i was still a bit hungry after eating my crepe since i have a big appetite haha.
author: Sylvia H.

description: The savory crepes were super good and super filling! I especially liked the one with eggplant.
author: Hannah J.

description: What a pleasant surprise to turn the corner and come upon a mobile creperie!  I enjoyed my strawberry jam crepe and couldn't have been happier to find this place.  Excited to try something savory next time!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
THEY ARE OPEN TIL 3:30AM on Saturday night. Just FYI.

So who knew that my crepe cravings can be satisfied after a night of clubbing. lol. Waay better than a hot dog or something. lol. (back when I used to eat meat)

They are located on the corner of a parking lot, there isn't really a sign to help locate them. It's a small red house is how I would describe it.

I ordered the Nutella Crepe with strawberries & bananas. YUMMERS!
So good! 

They don't only have dessert crepes, my cousin-in-law ordered a chicken & broccoli one & it looked bomb, minus the chicken. lol.
author: Camille C.

description:
Ummm haven't wrote a review in a while but I'm making time since they were open after the club in I'm here shoving this crepe into my mouth due to not wanting to waste money. 

So I get the powder sugar strawberry and whatever the number 22. Anywho I get it the whip cream awful SSOOO awful like it was beaten milk alone no sugar what so ever. Fresh strawberries was ok but guess their not in season because they weren't sweet either. Powder sugar not a trace, A TRACE I say !! What happen too many customers ?? Rushing orders out ?? Ugh yass great their open after the club. Sadly I wouldn't buy one for a dog if I had one. Sorry
author: Andrea B.

description:
The perfect late night snack after a Giants game! My husband and I were stalking this joint all day and we knew that if we waited, this place would open up and let us enjoy the amazingness that is nutella crepes!

We ordered the banana and nutella crepe and enjoyed it on our walk back to our hotel.  Warm, fresh and absolutely delicious! For $4, not a bad deal for a good snack!
author: Darina H.

description:
Service was OK; nothing special. I got a bacon egg and cheese crepe this morning. It was hot fresh and tasted great. 

Unfortunately, it was my first experience with food poisoning. I'm almost embarrassed to admit how horrid the defection was that followed this afternoon.

Maybe it's just an outlier, but I won't be buying half-ass service crepes from trucks anymore. I've never felt this sick from eating food. 

To the management - please please please make sure your employees are following food safety procedures so this does not happen to anyone of your other customers. 

Also - your "gluten free" options are a joke. You use the same grills, utensils, and gloves for all of the batters, resulting in gluten contamination. I'm not a celiac myself, but I know my friend who is would not be pleased nor feel comfortable eating at your establishment.
author: Alex D.

description:
Amazing savory and sweet crêpes batter. I am French and a crêpe snob. I decides to just try this place since it was on my way to the hotel I was staying at. The crepe were cooked just the way they are supposed to. I had the banana, almond, caramel. It was the right amount of sweet. The nutella, banana and strawberry #21 is their most raved one. My friend had it and was enjoying every bites.  Hope that this business will expand and be successful!!! It is a good hole in a wall place. 
Their ratatouille savory crêpe waa yummy too.
author: anthem C.

description:
I returned from Paris earlier this week and had a craving for crepes. I've been meaning to try Creperie St Germain for some time now so I figured why not? I ordered the #1 (cheese egg ham) and the #18 (salted caramel).

First off, these are not true buckwheat galettes. They don't have the gritty grainy texture of buckwheat, nor the crisp texture or the bubbles. If there is buckwheat flour in these crepes, it's definitely mixed into a while flour batter because the color and texture aren't right.

Next, my savory crepe was missing the egg. The ham was cut into chunks which wasn't what I expected. I don't know why but in my mind I pictured sliced ham instead of diced ham. Unfortunately, the caramel crepe was also a disappointment. The caramel was a thin, watery caramel and you could barely taste it between the layers of the uncrisp crepe. It was reminiscent of the "caramel" used in Starbucks drinks.

$13 lesson learned. Won't be going back here anytime soon!


ETA: I posted a photo of my crepe that was missing the egg, and Yelp removed it because it was "not representative" of the business. Well, it was representative of *MY* experience with the business. SMDH
author: Bella L.

description:
I go to the food truck by 2nd St. and Howard for a quick lunch. I love their #12 Braised Beef with all the other yummy ingredients like avocado, fried garlic, jalapeño, tomato, green onions, Swiss cheese*. It was a beautiful, bold experience for my taste buds. Very (ful)filling lunch.

I also had their #9 Smoked Turkey (Sauteed Mushrooms, Caramelized Onions, Creme Fraiche, Cheddar Cheese*), but it didn't excite my taste buds. I shouldn't compare its flavor to that of the Braised Beef because the Smoked Turkey fell flat in terms of character. A friend chided me about it. The whole ensemble's flavor should be mute given that it's turkey. I'll stick with my #12, thank you.

Unfortunately, their #20 chocolat, brownie chunks avec la crème chantilly was a disappointment. Elle m'a deçue! I needed my chocolate fix, and I ordered this to satisfy my craving for chantilly  (j'adore). The entire piece was dry, not just because of the crumbly brownie chunks, but because they forgot to include the chantilly. :( My chantilly! Ruined my day. 

I'll most likely continue going to Creperie St Germain and try their other savory crepes. I mean, #12 keeps me coming back anyway.

*ingredients listed are taken from their website menu: http://creperiesaintgermain.com/menus/csg-express/
author: Charlene H.

description: Nutella crepe with banana tasted average, but looked soggy and sad. It kills a craving but it's smaller in size and lacking in taste compared to Crepes Ooh La La on Polk.
author: Emily A.

description:
This is my first time here. My husband and I were really looking for something yummy and unfortunately we had the worst food experience in the USA. 

For the savory dishes No# 4-5, the crepe itself has no taste, nothing. Just the taste of flour no seasoning at all and it is not tasty at all. coming to the stuffing, chicken not cooked not seasoned (no salt or any other kind of seasoning) the only thing you can taste is cheese and with everything with it it taste awful.

As for sweet, I asked for something very basic (chocolate with bananas) again the crepe it self is horrible which also made the banana and chocolate horrible and with no taste :( 

Over all, the worst experience. We had to through half of the food and suffer of stomach pain for the rest of the day.
author: Afra'a S.

description:
I walked by this food stand and happened to also have a $3 Paypal deal as well, so wanted to check it out. I ordered the #1 Savory Crepe: Béchamel Grilled Chicken with Sautéed Mushroom, Swiss cheese, Tomato, Spinach. The person there was really nice, especially when I asked if I could switch out the swiss cheese for cheddar.  However, when I looked at my receipt, I realized I was charged for the cheddar switch. 

Overall, it seems like a fast-paced and easy to grab and go place, especially if you like crepes. They will hand out the crepes cone-style, but you can also ask them to put in a box for you like I did so you can carry it safely back to wherever it is you're going.

PROS: Easy to grab-and-go, nice people!, option to bring back in a box
CONS: Charged for switch-out
author: Sarah C.

description:
It was fine, I guess.  I had a gluten-free crepe with cheese, egg, and ham.  I heard them use a microwave, yet my cheese wasn't even melted...  The egg was pretty much missing, and the ham was inside, in big chunks.  

I don't think I'd go back, but it was alright, I suppose.
author: Valerie T.

description:
First time there. I asked what they were most famous for and he recommended 3 options. I went with one of "the most popular choices": the sausage with emmental cheese and caramelized onions. Sounds great right? Yeah well I got not one but several pieces of plastic in my crepe. Yuck! Not to mention that it was tasteless... I had to throw half of it away! And it wasn't cheap...it cost just under $9!
Too bad. I was really looking forward to finding my crepe spot.
author: Yummy Y.

description: Had #22. Not great at all. In addition, I ordered ahead of time. Once I arrived, they said they did not check for incoming online orders.
author: Terrence P.

description: Walked all the way over here because their menu online advertises buckwheat batter and all 100% gluten free.... Turns out they don't have gluten free batter at all?? Very disappointing. Why advertise if you don't offer it? Or maybe just the employee was uneducated. Hmmm.
author: Roya N.

description:
Been meaning to check this place out for awhile now... I mean I pass by it every time I go to the bus station...

Today was the day.

Coworkers and I were en route to Specialty's but I showed it to them and we decided to try it out... THANKFUL that we did!

Got there by 11:30ish and it wasn't busy yet... I got the Cheese, Ham, Egg for $6.95 and it came out pretty darn fast! 

It was piping hot... smelled good... good price... I was excited. 

First bite: WOW. I told them that we'll have to go back for dessert for sure! 

The buckwheat batter was awesome. Ham, cheese and egg... can't ask for more. 

We now have another place to get lunch... since SOMA isn't really much when it comes to lunch food! 

Staff was friendly and fast!

Definitely a must try... I think we're going back tomorrow!
author: Cath M.

description: Awesome. Just awesome. Fresh, warm, and good. Everything you would want in a crepe. Friendly service and fast preparation. Wish these were all over my neighborhood.
author: Shayne M.

description:
I've always like crepes and this is a nice location close to my office! I tried their savory crepe (#6 pork sausage) and it's amazing. Will definitely go back and try their sweet ones next time. 

I went at 12:30pm and it took me about 25-30 mins to order and get my crepe. Docking off one star because of the wait time but otherwise would be 5 star.
author: Janet K.

description:
I've had a couple crepes here, they all taste awesome; if it's a "meal crepe" it's really a hearty one for sure. If it's a "dessert crepe" it just hits the right note; not too sweet, not too heavy. I plan to visit more often!
Great for lunch and dessert :)
author: Michelle P.

description:
We used CSG for a corporate special event. I wanted to put on a crepe bar to give my team a little extra thank you. The quality of the ingredients, service and flexibility were essential to helping my team feel like they were treated like kings.

CSG sent a team of two with every fixing imaginable. With portable flat top electric burners, crepes took about 3 minutes per person (a stitch longer if they wanted egg).

Each mix-in ingredient was laid out in classy silver mixing bowls. Options galore would be an understatement. There were easily 25 different options to add to the crepes-both sweet and savory. From tofu to chorizo, spinach to nutella the possibilities for my team were endless.

As with any cross section of San Franciscans, there were a handful of people with dietary preferences. They were kind enough to accommodate needs with a gluten free, vegan and lactose intolerant options.

Priced at $14 a head there was more than enough food for everyone to have seconds and then some. They were responsible to my inquiry and cleaned and packed everything quickly.

If you are looking for a little extra somethingfor the corporate blues, I can't recommend them enough.
author: Ali R.

description:
Strawberry, Banana and Nutella! 

Loved that this place opens late, funny its just a cart, sucks its a little pricey and theres no where to sit (that I know of) but its pretty good! If you ever happen to be walking by might as well try it!
author: Jenny E.

description:
I found Creperie Saint Germain on Yelp while looking for gluten-free food & was really excited to see they had gluten-free crepe batter (not to mention a sizeable selection of crepe toppings!) 

The crepe was fine, but I was pretty disappointed by the customer service. When I asked which of the toppings were gluten-free, the cashier told me they all had gluten (kind of defeats the whole point of having gluten-free batter - not a fan), but I decided to take a chance & try anyway with one that looked like it would probably be ok, they cooked my gluten-free crepe on the same hot plate they had just cooked a regular crepe on. It sounds super anal, but this kind of thing actually does make a pretty big difference.

It turns out someone at work knows the owners and she's 100% sure all of the ingredients are gluten-free and they clean the hot plates thoroughly between each crepe. She has Celiac's disease so I'm inclined to believe her, but I doubt I'll go back unless I'm bored with my other options or just reaaaally want a crepe because of the customer service.
author: Sophie B.

description:
Salted Caramel Crepe ($6): Yummy! I don't usually like crepes other than the fillings, but this one was warm, had the perfect texture and is not as thin as other crepes! The filling was a warm gooey salted caramel filling. 

After you grab this from the cart, walk over to the Yueba Buena Gardens to enjoy!
author: Emily C.

description: It's my first time here. I got the number 9 which consisted of turkey, creme fraiche, Carmelized onions, cheese. I subbed turkey for egg. I asked the girl if the egg was the consistency of an egg salad sandwich where it's mashed. She said, "yeah something like that. They spread it around on the crepe is what she said so I assumed it was like the egg spread. When I get my crepe I looked inside and didn't see egg or my tomato that I added. I went back up to her to make sure and she said it was there.  Get back to work and start biting into it. Still no tomato or egg. Finally when I'm in the middle of my crepe, I decided to cut into it with a knife and fork. I found the egg all the way towards the bottom of the crepe. It was more like a flat egg that was wrapped in there. The white yolk still looked runny and still no tomato. I wanted to go back there to give it back and show them, but didn't want to waste my time. It's not too far from my work but also not worth my effort. So much for my 15% tip. The tomato was only $.50 to add, but still! $10.43 for a crepe I barely finished and now, I feel sick to my stomach.  I don't think I'll be back here again. I'll take my crepe money over to Genki crepes instead on clement. Waaaaay better quality. Too bad. Thought I was going to have a new favorite.
author: Sheena C.

description:
It's A-okay.

First, I have to mention that last year all the media reviews raving about this new crepe truck (a small trailer), failed to mention that there was already a "Crepes A Go Go" truck on 11th street (near Folsom), for MANY years before CSG. At least the CAGG truck has reliable hours (evenings only).

Second, the hours listed in every single media article has been wrong. Last year, I came to this location 5 or 8 times only to find it closed. Argh!!! (I didn't deduct any points for wasting my time). Their occasional random twitter posts are ineffective in comparison to other street vendors. Because most other vendors post twitter updates ASAP when they decide to change hours or close early. So far CSG has not done that, leaving many prospective customers in the dark. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QCZP-ZX487RXaVncZzeo2A/l

Well then, I'll be the helpful one to tell you their hours. They are open for lunch and close around 3pm on weekdays. On Friday and Saturday they open at 9pm until around 2am (maybe).

They use buckwheat on the batter which supposedly is better for you. Just like a thin soft unsweetened pancake, folded and filled with your choice of sweet or savory items. I ordered the crepe with apple, brown sugar and cinnamon ($5.50). http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/oixCo2vGHoULlgFhehrXgw/l All prices are under $10, and many are under $6. The crepes are made to order, so it takes a while. Don't bother ordering if you see many people ahead of you (unless you like to wait). http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0BwGnQRXsFhn1caZe7QZTw/l

Personally, I prefer the crispy Japanese crepes from places like Sophie's Crepes, Genki, or Belly Good Cafe (and other places I can't remember right now).

Update: They've moved. Check Facebook or Twitter for other new locations and hours. http://www.facebook.com/pages/Creperie-Saint-Germain/105906206285
author: Luis C.

description:
CREPES GO TO CRAP WITH THE TYPE OF SHITTY SERVICE YOU'D EXPECT IN A TOURIST TRAP IN PARIS

This morning I tried to order a crepe at this place. I've been here a few times before and the crepes were good, but the wait was a bit longish. I would say, though that it was worth the wait until today. 

This AM, it was a completely different story. I selected my crepe off the menu and went to the counter to order. I saw a woman in the corner and said hello. She literally glared back at me as if I was interrupting her in the middle of saving a life and turned around to continue flipping a crepe (she had no customers so perhaps it was for her) and kept her back to me for what must have been a minute. She then turned back and said in the surliest voice I have heard recently "are you ready to order?," and then turned back away.

Why does expansion of a business in San Francisco have to mean hiring surly, insolent workers who are certain that what they are doing is beneath them? Why is it so much to ask to find someone who might like making gourmet crepes and is capable of being pleasant with the public?

I won't be spending another dime here until that woman is gone. Service and food quality is all you have where you are a shack on the street after all. What a sad performance from a business I used to like.
author: Ken P.

description: Really like their crepes, getting one right now in fact. Quick and convenient, and the quality is very good.
author: Chris N.

description:
Food. #4 savory was delicious. So was #21 plain Nutella. 
Service. Friendly and loved their recommendations.
author: JL M.

description:
To set you in the mood...http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nHiZ15x6Vt4

"Boy, it's been a nong time since dem days with da gang. Hi, I'm Buh'weet, amemba me? And I have made, pu you and ya eatin' pejure, some of my fa'vite crepes. It's all here at this un pectacular trailuh. Buh'weet is cookin'!..O-TAY!" (...cue for the moaning saxophone solo of the "Our Gang" theme) 

If you haven't guessed by now, buckwheat crepes are the specialty here made on two griddles in a trailer. I think they should hire Eddie Murphy to do his Buckwheat imitation to generate more business for this mobile creperie next to Prana and Temple nightclub. After all, his career still hasn't recovered from "Pluto Nash" and "Norbit". Otherwise, it's fairly nondescript except for the smiling girl who serves the crepes from the window. 

They offer an extensive menu of crepes, both sweet and savory. The sweet ones even come with a scoop of ice cream for a buck extra. Since it was lunchtime when I strolled by today, I went for one of the savories, the $6.95 Sauteed Chicken with Bechamel Sauce and Sauteed Mushroom. I thought it was pretty good, a bit salty and a tad paltry for the price. A nice side salad could have helped, but accessories are not an option here. Waffles are though and apparently a $5 bread bowl of tomato soup. 

Oh, I'll come back because it is a convenient stop on Howard that doesn't require me to brave the urine-soaked sidewalk heading toward Second. An awning would have been worthwhile on a warm day like today... and maybe a couple of stools. Alas, they just got started, so I'm hoping business builds and they can make such extravagant investments. OK, OK, so I already used Eddie Murphy's Buckwheat character in my Ti Couz review, but hey, it works... 

FOOD - 3 stars...a middling savory crepe...now I must try the sweet 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's a trailer...what ya expectin'? 
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...O-TAY!!! 
TOTAL - 3 stars...give it some time, mon ami
author: Ed U.

description: The food was phenomenal. I had #7 with avocados instead of jalapenos and it was one of the best crepes I have ever had.
author: Ashwin T.

description: My grand-mother was from Brittany and she taught me about the tradition of crepes: she was making her own ones. Let me tell you that the sugar & butter from Creperie Saint Germain is absolutely delicious, and I know what I'm talking about! A great spot I know for a while now: I strongly recommend.
author: Phil J.

description:
Worst crepe ever.

Cold cheese. Soggy crepe. Long wait. Indifferent service. Awful flavor.

Oh, and the paper wrap did stick to the crepe in an unmanageable way.

I had been really, really excited about this place and ended up throwing out my breakfast. That, like, never happens. 

You are so cute, Creperie Saint Germain, why aren't you delicious? 

Was it just person working the stand?!!? I am afraid to try my luck another day....
author: Rachel G.

description: Really terrible service by a very indifferent worker. Waiting for my crepe now hope it taste ok.....
author: Betty C.

description: I had the chicken with mushrooms crepe and i loved it. It's freshly made to order, so the waiting line is a little long especially during lunch hours. So rush a little early to get ahead of the line.
author: Fatema M.

description: Tiny place, big flavor! I am glad I don't live nearby, I would be much heavier with a lighter wallet. I love the buckwheat crepes here.
author: Sunil R.

description: Fantastic crepes from a small shack. The portions are relatively large... and soooo good. The feta/kalamata olive crepe was delicious and healthy. The brownie and chocolate creme crepe was to die for. Definitely recommended!!
author: A T.

description:
There are a limited number of crepe places in the city, especially good ones. Came here for lunch last week and I was delighted to find this little "permanent" food truck pumping out great crepes! Healthy buckwheat crepe and your choice of fillings. They have great options on the menu already put together. 

The wait was short and it was easy to walk and eat on a beautiful day in SOMA. I will definitely be back!
author: Carlynn A.

description:
One of the best crepes that i have had, in this city or anywhere else (have not been to France, so take this as you will). Delicious, consistent, and super healthy compared to other lunchtime options out there.
Highly recommended.
author: Jesse C.

description:
I've walked by this office several times getting off the bus stop and heading to work, and I've always been intrigued by it. Finally decided to give it a shot when nothing at the office seemed appealing.

It seems like they were out of several ingredients when I went - the two girls trying to order before me had to order about 3 times total because what they wanted always had a missing ingredient. Luckily, the crepe I got (forgot what it was called, but had bacon, cheese, and onions - yum!) was delicious.

I think they could be friendlier and faster - there was only one person working so it took a while for her to make the crepes.
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
Came here while clubbing. My buddy got smashed, left the club, and was wandering the streets of SF (he ended up kissing a transvestite but that's a story for another time).  

Anyhow, I went out to search for him, but I was super hungry so I made a pit stop.  I figured if he was passed out in a ditch somewhere, he could wait a few more minutes while I ate.

So I ordered the number 20, the guy told me the price without blinking an eye.  He had it memorized! WTFeezy there's like 40 crepes with different prices for all of them.  What a pro.  

3 minutes later, I had my crepe in my hand.  It was large, stuffed with spinach and being drunk, tasted pretty damn good.  The spinach was uncooked but because everything was so hot, it wilted to just the right texture.  Whatever sauce it was in the crepe was exquisite.  

I can see why this place gets a huge line after the clubs let out, I'm glad I got there early.

Check it out next time you're out and about on Howard.
author: Tu T.

description:
Another one of the many restaurants that used to cater for our office, I can't claim to have ever been to their actual truck before. As caterers though, they'll bring in all the ingredients necessary to make many of the crepes they have to offer, both savory and sweet, along with some portable crepe griddles, to make them hot and fresh, as requested.

The buckwheat batter used to make the crepes is definitely a matter of personal preference - my taste buds tend to prefer the standard crepe batter used elsewhere, as well as thinner crepes, but this isn't terrible, by any means (and hey, it's supposed to be healthier right?). Overall, not bad, but not amazing. If you're in the area, and are hungry, they make for a decent choice, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Besides, if you're looking for tasty dessert crepes, Genki Crepes out in Inner Richmond is kind of awesome, and worth the trek.
author: Johnny W.

description: A nice food stand in a convenient location :) I really enjoyed my savory crepe with delicious smoked salmon. It wasn't the most filling meal for its price but it was definitely worth trying. The line wasn't too long when I went, but since there was only one person tending the stand, it took kind of long to get my food.
author: Alice H.

description: It may be unrealistic of me to think I can find a good-tasting gluten-free crepe, but I was hoping.  Their GF batter is made from buckwheat, which at first concerned me until I researched & found that buckwheat is, indeed, gluten-free.  Still, it was tasteless, & not at all what I hoped for.  I wound up throwing at least half of it away.
author: Alyx M.

description: YUM!!! I've had three crepes from here in less than 24 hours...sooooo good! Conveniently located a couple of blocks from the Courtyard by Marriott on 2nd Street.  Had both the Sugar with butter crepe and the Smoked Salmon crepe...wonderful!
author: Terri S.

description:
Went to this place at 2am after a movie. I'm not much of a crepe person, but this place was actually pretty good. I had the savory crepe with smoked salmon, cream cheese, capers, green onions, and mixed greens. Really good! Definitely loved it. Salmon was a little salty, but the crepe balanced it out. 

I imagine this place gets a lot of business because of the late night clubs around the area. I couldn't walk 5 minutes without seeing people in short skirts or wobbling around because they were drunk. The area was a little scary, but didn't seem too bad because of all the people around.

I'd definitely come back here again if I was in the area.
author: Robert Y.

description: Why would you advertise on your website as having gluten-free options if you don't always have them? They didn't have the gluten-free batter when I came. My friends enjoyed their gluten-filled crepes while I watched without anything to eat.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Note: This should be designated as the Express location. 

On the way to work, the smell of cheese and meat caught my attention. Without even asking anything or investigating the menu, I was drawn to something that mentioned eggs, cheese, and mushrooms. Only after paying did it become apparent to me that they'd come in the form of a crepe, made to order of course. 

The wait's only a few minutes. It felt much longer because I was in "work mode" already, but compulsively looking at the time while thinking about how to knock out the tasks of the day kept me in check. 

Being hungrier than normal that morning, what would be a heavy crepe felt nearly robust after I devoured it while walking the next three blocks. Honestly, it probably would've been the same result after a night of drinking anyway. 

Pro move 1: Go online first and pick out a couple of tasty-looking combos. Split them with someone else since one whole crepe is big enough to fill you most people.

Pro move 2: Use a credit card, and save your cash for a taxi.
author: Mike H.

description: Great Place to go to, if you have a craving after clubbing :) It is pretty close to the freeway, so you can stop by really quick before you enter the freeway, conveniently located for me. Usually I get some sweet crepes from them, anything with Nutella. Enjoy!
author: Carolin M.

description:
Thank you for the new location... it's closer to my work! I usually pass by this place in the morning. My usual default breakfast is fruit and yogurt, but there are times I need more then that. Enter Creperie Saint Germain and it's sweet crepes... cause I'm just not a savory crepe kinda person. Not to mention the guy that works in the morning is so nice it makes you just have to get a crepe!

I've had the Sugar & Butter, Sugar & Lemon, and the Honey, Banana & Almonds- all great additions to fruit and yogurt. The crepes are huge, I eat half for breakfast and the other half as a snack. No disappointments so far and it's made breakfast in the SOMA so much better! Besides, the crepes are made from buckwheat batter- that's healthy, right? ;)
author: S Y.

description:
Needed a new lunch spot after I started working in the SOMA last week. Naturally I turned to my fellow Yelpers for suggestions. This spot was one of the top results.

Here's what you need to know:
-It's in a parking lot on the SW corner of 2nd and Howard
-It is NOT cash only (which is why I unnecessarily stopped by the ATM); The woman behind me paid by card 
-Expect delicious hand-crafted pillows of delight, just oh-so-lightly toasted and filled with fresh ingredients
-Be ready to spend about $7.50 to $9 for savory crepes and a couple of bucks less for basic sweet ones
-Try the ratatouille one! Tender eggplant, gooey Swiss cheese, and peppers make the perfect lunch.
-Portions are generous. I didn't even need to have my usual afternoon snack after having my ratatouille crepe at noon.
-Go around noon time to avoid a heavy rush. I got my crepe in about 5 minutes.

I'm coming back soon with friends.
author: Teresa G.

description:
I am really against writing bad reviews but unfortunately, I can't let this negative experience slide..

I hate being a negative person, so let's start off with the good news.. I was searching on yelp for a new place to eat for lunch and came across this creperie I remember seeing some late nights at Temple.. I've always wanted to try this place but never had cash on me when I came around.. I decided I'd have time to go to the bank, get cash, and try this place out in my short 30 minute break.. I assumed it was still in the same place but it wasn't so I called to ask where they were.. 

The girl who answered the phone was friendly, telling me they were actually on 2nd and Howard in front of Umbria.. Okay cool. So before she hung up, I SPECIFICALLY ASKED if they had SHRIMP still because it was the only thing on the menu that I had interest in trying.. She said yes and so I said great, I'll be there in a few..

I get there, and this couple in front of me were rummaging through their stuff because they didn't have enough money to pay for their two crepes.. This goes on for awhile, then the girl suggests an ATM nearby.. They end up finding more cash/change/whatever but they were still short .20 cents.. The girl says it's okay but you can tell it really wasn't because she was slamming around the cash in irritation.. They already had their crepes so she just turned her back on them and the couple went on their way and even shouted out that they'll be back to cover the 20 cents.. I'm sure he said that because he saw the irritation in her actions.. 

So I get to the window and awkwardly stand there for a while because she had her back turned to the window.. When she finally turned around, I placed my order for the #19 and she goes, oh that was you that called.. I was like yeah, I thought you guys were over there by Temple cause that's where I saw you before.. Then we make a little small talk about the Transbay Terminal being built there when the guy in the back tells her they're out of shrimp..

The girl seemed to be concerned, telling him that I had just called asking for shrimp.. He goes and says, well we had shrimp when you called but that girl before you ordered it so we ran out.. Really? You couldn't tell me that when I called? That you only had enough for ONE more order that wasn't mine but instead, the girl who didn't even pay full price? Unbelieveable..

And even worse, they didn't really recommend an alternative or offer some kind of restitution for having told me they had something and then coming to find out they don't.. I asked if they could substitute the shrimp with anything else since I wasn't really interested in any of the other crepes.. They kept suggesting to put the little shrimp into an entirely different crepe.. I don't understand why they kept trying to push me to try something I didn't really want. I also don't understand why they couldn't just add more avocado or even leaves to the crepe I had wanted.. I would have been okay with that.. I even asked them if they could just make it with what they had, and they just kept saying no they don't have enough.. So I relunctanly asked if they could suggest anything else in hopes they could convince me something else was as enticing but no...

The guy then said, we'll have more shrimp tomorrow.. We would usually have more shrimp but the guy didn't deliver us enough today..

I'm sorry but I don't want to wait until tomorrow to try something I wanted TODAY.. If you advertise something on your website, or any other media available to consumers, I expect it to be there at the time of order. 

By the time he said that, I felt like they were just trying to get rid of me, so I just asked for my money back and walked away.. I ended up wasting all my lunch and didn't even get to try ANYTHING from this place.. So now I'm back at work, hungry, grumpy and antsy to share this with all of you..

Though this shouldn't seem surprising since it looks like they've shorted a few other yelpers out there too.. 

To think, I was ready to tip them and cover the 20 cents that couple was short of, but it looks like I won't be coming back.. Sad.. I was really excited to have a new go-to-place for lunch..

I guess I'll just stick to Metro Crepes which is much closer to my work and probably won't run out of stuff like this cart..
author: Jayne S.

description:
I thought the crepes here this weekend were A-OK....nothing special. Tried the banana/nutella and the ham/cheese/egg.

Service wasn't great -- not a very friendly employee!
author: K. D.

description: The reviewers who praise this place for its "large portions" must be sedentary anorexic people who only burn 100 calories per day. I highly doubt one crepe has more than 500 calories, so it can't qualify as lunch even for a moderately active person. Enjoy paying nearly 10 bucks for your HALF-meal. At least it tastes good.
author: Max L.

description:
This place has the best savory crepe's I've ever had (that I can remember)! They put SO many ingredients into the crepe, and for some reason, it's not all dripping out as you walk and eat. 

I tried the chicken, which was soooo delicious. Cheesy and creamy and very crisp.

I also tried the ratatouille. It was good, but I didn't like it as much (probably because there was no meat). It had eggplant/onions/spinach/cheese. 

Both were $7.50.

YUMMMMMMMMMM

Definitely going to try a sweet one next time. :)
author: Jeanette S.

description: The only downside to this little pop-up creperie is the lack of options, as compared to Crepes a Go Go on 11th is the lack of options. This creperie deems itself an upscale creperie with goat cheese and other culinary "upgrades" spelled in French, but it's really just a very basic creperie that is no different than any other you can go to. Sure, you can get a ratatouille crepe, but it's really just a veggie crepe with swiss cheese. Not too fancy in my book, but I love my crepes, both savory and sweet, so I'm not complaining. And, it's not overly expensive either while being very speedy. Oh! They accept credit cards. Win.
author: Danny C.

description:
Was starving after clubbing and stumbled across this fancy little crepe cart. A little pricey for a crepe, but the fact that they operate out of a cart, have gourmet crepes and are open late, makes it totally worth it. 

I had a savory crepe with sausage, onion and cheese and a sweet crepe with nutella, strawberries and banana. Both were delish!

Crepes are kinda small, so I don't think one will fill you up, but great for a snack!
author: Maggie Y.

description:
After eating lunch down the street, I needed something sweet.  And naturally my eyes gravitated towards the crepe that simply had the most STUFF in it.

I would advise against getting the Chocolate/Coconut/Banana/Caramel Sauce/Whip Cream/Almond crepe not because of the taste (because it is quite good) but because... well did you read all that?   As my friend described, it is literally the size of a Costco slice of pizza.  Three girls couldn't even finish this.  I can't even imagine what this would do to one person.  Poor soul.

This was basically an overload of items but all the ingredients were very fresh.  They do not skimp by any means and the crepe skin was nice and crispy.  Next time I may even go for a plain crepe with butter.  I like that the menu has unique combinations that you don't normally see which can include chestnut spread, apple sauce, and ricotta.  Make your choice wisely.
author: Shannon L.

description: Delicious gluten free crepes! Sooo tasty. I had Nutella and strawberries. It was perfect and only about 7 bucks. The truck appears to be the only one who have gluten free though.
author: Rachel B.

description:
I wouldn't say this place is a 3 or a 4, but more like a 3.5. It's good, but not great.

I got the strawberry, banana and nutella. The first couple of bites were delicious. Everything you would expect out of crepe - nice slightly chewy crepe and sweet decadent fillings. HOWEVER, towards the end of my crepe, I noticed that the banana tasted a little bit older. Like not as fresh as the first few pieces. Not sure if it was because they used a cooked banana or they really didn't use a fresh banana but it was NOT good. that was about 3 bites towards the end. The rest of the crepe was good.

Service is good, not fantastic. But they are fast. All in all I say it's a good place to get your crepe fix on the go.
author: Ceana K.

description:
Good tasting crepes from chicken to dessert crepes - all wrapped conveniently to be hand held!

Its a oversized street cart residing right on the corner of the intersection of 2nd & Howard, on a private parking lot. Opens till 3am for those with the "munchies"!

Great for On-the-go!
author: Alvin A.

description:
Lawd have mercy, this place is good!! I've only tried the chicken/spinach/béchamel/mushroom (#20) because I just couldn't get myself to order anything else.

First off, the crepe itself is top notch. The dough has a hearty flavor, a bit crispy on the edges and tender on the inside. There's a bit of crunch from the raw spinach to add a bit of texture and the sauce really pulls the whole thing together. 

Crepes don't get better than this :)
author: Alice W.

description:
I've now been to this place a dozen times and I stand by my original review. Every single time I ask for "a very very little bit of cheese" and I get something with not just an average amount of cheese but gobs and gobs of it. Whoever says these are like the crepes you see on the streets of Paris is smoking crack. These are American crepes.

Also some of the morning guys are nice but many are no-nonsense. I guess I'd just like a smile or two in the morning.
author: Paul C.

description: Funny that I was in Paris for a week but didnt have any crepes. I then get back to CA and go to two places. One of them being at a shack in a parking lot in Soma. Surprisingly though a fairly good crepe even at 2 am. Ham, cheese and bacon is generally hard to go wrong with. They definitely executed here. What a treat fr those drunkards coming out of the bars and clubs. I guess I heard they're opening two more locations so they must be doing something right
author: Kim N.

description:
Every now and then I get a craving for quick fix crepes. Where do I head off to? Why, Creperie Saint Germain, of course!

A photobooth sized establishment, this place knows how to rock out quick and tasty sweet or savory crepes. My personal fave is the Mediterranean. The ingredients are fresh and the buckwheat batter is pretty good. Their customer service is always pleasant.

Nice place to grab some lunch. Oh, and like I've mentioned above, this place is the size of a closet (no tables or chairs), so expect your yummy crepe to be eaten on foot or to go.
author: Ann S.

description: Got my usual crepe order:  mushrooms and jack cheese.  It was super cheesy (like I asked it to be) with tender buttery mushrooms.  My only complaint is you could tell he used a s***load of butter.  Don't get me wrong; I love butter.  And, I'm not saying that I didn't eat and enjoy my entire crepe in record time.  But, I probably would have enjoyed it just as much if he used half the amount of butter.
author: Christina L.

description:
Yay finally a crepe stand in the FiDi! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oMm7BhT4bkr-YVS3_kg-9g?select=blUSZ6bGfZM693j-5-71-A) It's located right next to a parking lot between 1st and New Montgomery on Howard. The lady that worked there was really friendly and our food came out in under 10 minutes! The boy and I choose 2 crepes to try:

cheese mushroom and spinach ($6.50*) 
cheese turkey and egg ($6.95*)

*prices were raised from $6 and $6.50
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oMm7BhT4bkr-YVS3_kg-9g?select=v83eerPPg5Utz3vVfkI72g)

The crepes were soft, freshly made, and wrapped in foil on a paper tray. There was a hint of sweetness in the buckwheat batter and it tasted healthy and amazing! The sauteed mushrooms with onions and fresh spinach one was to die for...the melted cheese brought everything together. It was a little messy with the dripping sauce from the mushrooms but so worth it. I sampled the turkey one too and it tasted like breakfast...yum!

Filled me up too but not overly so. Cash only. Will make the trek here again soon!
author: Karen Y.

description: Guy closed at 3:00 because he didn't have many customers... yelp hours say 3:30... Not entirely true. May want to give them a ring before making the trip over.
author: Sasan R.

description: A great quick lunch if you can't eat gluten. They asked about my gluten-free needs (did I need the hot plate cleaned? Yes!) which is more than I can say about a lot of places. The service was pretty slow, but that could have been because they were taking pains to clean the hot plate for me.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Ok so apparently one of the side effects of beer is that it makes EVERYTHING TASTE DELICIOUS. That being said, I was drunk and decided to have a crepe at this place.

I had a nutella and strawberry crepe shared with my fat and I mean FAT friend, so there was very little left to eat, but whatever I did eat was frickin delicious. Mother says sugar is for good children but I told mother "I do way ah want!" and then I snapped my fingers three times, snap snap snap, and delivered the sass. She had nothing to say after that, thats right mom. Sugar all day, every day!
author: Kevin M.

description: I walked over here from my office for a Friday afternoon lunch and a few things disappointed me: It was 12:30 and they were already out of avocado and roasted peppers, and they did not get my order correct.  This could have been an isolated incident but it didn't make my experience worthwhile. The crepe itself was standard and because they didn't add the beef and roasted peppers, i was left with goat cheese, green peppers tomato and spinach for $8.50.   Also they Egg is cooked in the crepe rather than separately which is not what i was expecting. My girlfriend was pleased with her crepe so i might have just had some bad luck. Not sure if i will come back hereI
author: Steven G.

description: This is a food van.   I got a crepe with sausage and cheese.  Basically they threw some precooked sausages and cheese onto the crepe.  The problem is it was dripping with the liquid from the sausage.  This is way too soggy compared to the genuine thing in France.  Therefore 2 stars.
author: Will T.

description:
I've had a lot better.  Ate here a few days ago, and ordered the rock shrimp crepe, with avocado, tarragon, basil, lime and lettuce.  Sounded great, but the fact that I was one of the very few customers to be seen in their little plaza should have been a clue.  They forgot most of the ingredients, and the shrimp was not rock shrimp at all... it was just some very small, boiled shrimp.  Overall it was the buckwheat crepe with small, watery shrimp and a lot of dry lettuce.

I also got the chocolate crepe with banana, coconut, caramel sauce and almonds.  Again with the forgetting of the ingredients, because it had the banana and the chocolate, that was it.

I feel like this is one of those cases where the owner of the chain tried to get his/her employees up to speed at the beginning, then just let them go.  They don't seem to know what they're doing at all.  The owner could do well to check up on what's going on there every once in a while, 'cause it's gone down the drain.
author: Wayne Q.

description:
Drippy.... but excellent.

Found them at Second and Howard.  Mushrooms, tomato, and spinach fit nicely in a sunny day.
author: Ken M.

description:
Everyday, I am literally racing across Howard from the Terminal and I've always noticed this little white, quaint trailer. So I thought to myself, I must try this at some point in time. And I finally did!!!

And why oh why had I not tried it earlier? It was delightful to run out into the sun and munch on these juicy crepes under the sunshine. I got the mushroom + avocado + cheese crepe. Mushroom, perfectly juicy. 

mmm-M. Will run over here again!!! Cash only!
author: Catherine N.

description: Not just any crepe but a beloved shack that is catered to late night early morning diners. Looking for a food place synchronized with down town clubbing time? Here you go. Watch out lots of one way here, check direction walking is the best. The crepes are lighter dryer less creamy.
author: Dilys S.

description:
Update:

Went at 12:30 today.  There were about 10 people in front of us.  This trip took a lot longer than expected.  Many mistakes were made before us.

Swapped chicken for turkey for one of our crepes.  They need to know how to handle volume/peak times better.

The double eggs, double turkey and extra cheese crepe was okay.  Not as enthused as I was the first time around, but still good.
author: Jenny L.

description: Let me start off by saying the strawberry and creme crape was good. Not the best I ever had but huge and good. I knocked off one star for customer service... I asked when I ordered if I could have my crepe a little under cooked. She made a funny face then asked if I wanted it crispy, I said no....I said under cooked and she rolled her eyes at me. Who does that?! Will probably not eat here again for fear of the eye rolling!
author: Ann B.

description:
I had never been around this neighborhood for lunch during the week but was out the other day and saw the line here and it reminded me that I wanted to try this place out.  The woman working there was really friendly.  They didn't have shrimp for the shrimp crepe I wanted to order so I got the Maya's special which includes a lot of beef, beans, avocado, etc.  The crepe was very tasty and the beef had a really good flavor.  At first it looked so large that I wouldn't be able to finish it but I was and it was delicious.

For a quick, relatively inexpensive meal, check out the Creperie Saint Germain for delicious crepes.
author: Blake B.

description:
They were nice and serving at 1:25 am, which is why I am giving a three star. I have been to much better, much more generous crepe places. Ordered a nutella crepe and one with sundried tomatoes and spinach. When I got in my car and pulled out the nutella one (I was hungry after dancing three hours and dessert first is always a treat!) I was surprised to find it hard, too crispy and with very little nutella in it. It was tiny for $5. 

When I got home the savory one was in the box in a white paper cone wrapper. I saw the size of the paper cone and thought "finally, a big crepe." Well, the cone was totally false advertisement. The crepe inside it was barely half the size of the paper. There was very little cheese, very greasy sundried tomatoes dripping every where and hardly any onions. Again, a dry crepe and it had been in its box steaming. 

How much did my duo of crepes cost? $15 plus I put a dollar in the tip jar (it was a food truck). So glad I did not tip better cause I would have been even more mad than I was. The crepe truck over near the DNA lounge does a much better job, at a similar price but they give you so much more. 

Was it good? Yes, but not worth it for the price and size. My suggestion to them is to ditch the cone wrappers unless they are actually going to make a crepe that fits it. Think about ordering a pint container of something at a deli, and they only fill it half full. Just wrong! I think to be fair I might have to give them a try at lunch time and see if the day shift does any better.
author: Theresa S.

description: My first visit today. I couldn't be more appetized! These are not dinky crepes AND they're full of stuffing, super healthy, plus BUCKWHEAT crepes. Never heard of it, but awesome flavor!! I got the #4 grilled chicken mmmm mmmm mmm sorry I should've taken a picture but it's almost all gone in my tummy. I recommend a try and another try and a return try and a come back frequently try :-)
author: Joanna V.

description: After roaming around the streets past midnight and finding out that every restaurant's kitchen was closed, my friends and I settled for crepes at this spot. A modest little stand, but I kid you not, they make a pretty damn good crepe! Better than some crepes I've had at sit down restaurants. I got the #14 (cheese, bacon, mushroom, creme fraiche) and it was super filling. If only I had room for a dessert crepe (that is my only gripe). They use buckwheat batter which I'm usually not a fan of, but here it was quite delicious! The guy behind the counter is nice and slightly witty too. What's not to love?
author: Angeline K.

description:
At the beginning of our staycation in San Francisco, the boyfriend surprised me by taking me here for our first meal out in the city. It's this quaint little crepe cart that sits in a parking lot. You walk up to the little window, order, pay, then sit on the curb to wait until they call your number for your crepe.

Now, I am a huuuuge fan of dessert crepes (I used to try to get one about once every two weeks or so while I was still in school), so I was thrilled when he showed me the place. I can't remember what we got now (it's what I get for writing the review months after we actually visited the place), but I do remember that they were savory crepes because we were starving and it was lunchtime.

The wait was short and we walked ourselves over to the nearby Yerba Buena Garden to enjoy our crepes. I remember them being big, filling and absolutely delicious (that's what she said).

I want to give them a higher rating, but I honestly don't remember much about the place. I'll have to try them again, then update this review at another time. I would recommend them -- but I just don't remember any specific things to recommend.
author: Anna W.

description: Since my office is nearby, I eat here all the time. It's a great place for lunch - I get the 3 cheese crepe and add mushrooms. The service is friendly, though occasionally it is really slow, even with only a few people waiting. That's my only complaint - otherwise,  I love them!
author: Emily M.

description:
This is a good late night option for dessert if you are in SOMA, particularly if you have just left the W bar. lol

I got a strawberry and cream crepe and devoured it pretty quickly. Be careful as you tear/peel back the wrapping as the crepes are kinda floppy. My friend dropped several of my precious strawberry pieces on the ground!! :( :( :(
author: Kenny J.

description:
Delicious, affordable and the nicest and sweetest woman ever working there!

They're so friendly and even offered me a free drink because it took too long to cook it. It's about 200 feet from my office and their dessert crepes are TO DIE FOR!
author: Adam C.

description:
January rainstorm in SOMA.

But I have waited far too long for a haircut. And today simply must be the day. Didn't bother to bring an umbrella. It's haircut day anyway, right?

Grumble grumble.

Oh that's right. I forgot to get any lunch. And now it's after 2pm. And here I am waiting for the light at 2nd and Folsom.

Rain rain rain. Walk walk walk. Rain rain rain.

Oh! There's that Crepe place up ahead on the corner. I wonder if they are open? I know they were closing for a remodel or something.

Yes! They are open!

Stand under the awning. Check out the menu. Hmmm. What to have. What to have. Let's go with something healthy. How about the Ratatouille Crepe? Eggplant, bell pepper, onions, spinach and cheese. Sounds delightful.

Love the smell of rain. City needed a bath anyway. Sniff sniff. Oh my. That crepe in there smells gooooooood.

There it is. Oooh. Warm. A little fragrant handwarmer to walk with. Sniffffffff. Mmmm. That smells good.

Walk walk. Rain rain. Sniff sniff. Okay I need to stop somewhere and get a bite. This overhang will do. Hopefully no one tries to open this door.

Just one bite. Nom... mmmm... Oh wow that was good. Nom. mmmm... sooooo good. Nom.... nom.... NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM.... Nom...

Whew. I don't know what came over me there. Why am I standing here? Where am I? Oh yeah. Haircut. MMMmmmmm. Happy belly.

I love walking in the rain.
author: TJ P.

description:
Been to their food truck and love their sweet crepes!  I always get the apple crepe with caramel - delicious like an apple pie.  I've only tried a savory crepe once and it was the one with lox and capers, which was too salty.

One crepe usually isn't filling, so try one savory, one sweet.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
MUCH better drunk food than a bacon wrapped hot dog!

The savory crepes are filling and stuffed with veggies.
author: Chrissy L.

description:
I've been here for lunch and late b'fast dessert crepes but i was not aware that they were opened till 3a++ on the weekends!
WHA??????????
Amazing. We came here for a midnight snack after both 21st Amendment and District closed their kitchens before midnight (LAME-O)
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Seems to be a very limited number of ingredients used here which makes substitution difficult. Little pricey for what amounts to snack food.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I've been back a couple more times, only slightly more sober... and the food definitely is nothing to write home about. I've had a savory one (with chicken, spinach, mushroom, tomatoes, and bechamel sauce) and a dessert one (brownie chunks, chocolate, and strawberries maybe?). The savory one was pretty standard -- what you'd get at most chain creperies like the crepevine, etc. -- but nothing special. The dessert one was also pretty standard, but the chocolate/fillings were not spread evenly and so 1/4 of  the time I was eating it, it was just the buckwheat... :(
