Slightly crispy buckwheat crepe, the buckwheat flavor wasn't too over-powering. The fruits were ripe & sweet. Definitely a must try.
author: Kitty K.

description: Delicious Crepes.  I was unsure how they would present a to-go crepe, but the paper and foil triangle made this meal as eatable as your everyday burrito.   I had the chicken crepe, it was delicious. next time i'm goin for a dessert crepe though, they smelled amazing.
author: Matt C.

description:
crepe craving after the club?? this is the place to go! we were in SF for the weekend and after we finished off a night of dancing, the food cravings hit us and this place showed up when we searched for the nearest place to eat. they've got a variety of crepes, both sweet and savory, but i prefer sweet crepes filled with strawberries and chocolate over crepes with fish and vegies. 
the stand was located about two blocks from our hotel, so we didnt have worry about driving and finding a place to park.
the only downside is that the lines get long and there's only one or two people working, so it might take a while before getting your food.
author: Joy V.

description: Any food venue on wheels is something I can't resist. So I was psyched when I heard of this place. Walking by this place just smelled great. The line moved pretty quick and the price was fair. I had a savory crepe (ham, eggs, and cheese) and it was really good. I will admit I inhaled it pretty much. I was contemplating ordering a dessert crepe at the time, but I was rather full with my one crepe. Good place, hope to check it out some more.
author: Greg G.

description:
I was a little leery about ordering crepes from a cart in a parking lot, but I was pleasantly surprised!

I ordered the chicken crepe and it was delicious! The crepe was light, crispy, and warm. The veggies inside were fresh and tasty. I was filled up completely without feeling like I overate.

The only downside is the cash-only payment methods. The food was served quickly and with a friendly attitude. Mere steps from my office door, I will be eating here again!
author: Rachel Q.

description:
Stopped by this new place for lunch yesterday and had the Mediterranean crepe.  It was yummie.  Good quality and quantity of ingredients yet it was not heavy or too filling.  Just hit the spot.
Great option for a quick lunch bite in SOMA.  Get there a bit earlier or slightly later than the rush hour and you'll be even better off.
author: Atakan C.

description: I almost always don't remember when I eat here, not because the food isn't good but simply because the only time I go here is right after drinking/dancing my cheeks off at Temple Night club, until recently when my friend and I came here after a night at temple, a night where I actually paced myself with drinking. I don't know what it was, maybe I was famished, but the crepes tasted pretty amazing in my mouth, so amazing that apparently I left a bite for my friend(ok, so maybe I didn't pace good enough). but I seriously just remember it tasting really good. I'm going to have to make a sober trip soon!
author: Joy L.

description: Meat in a crepe?  Ugh (not!!!)  I used to think crepes should only be reserved for Nutella and fruits but no longer!  This crepe truck is located right downstairs from work so my friends and I decided to try it out one day.  I tried the delectable cheese, smoked turkey, and cranberry crepe.  I'm a pretty slow eater but I don't think I've scarfed anything down so fast; it was amazing!  Now I must say, I almost always order a Turkey & Cranberry sandwich anywhere I go and although not exactly in the sandwich category, Creperie Saint Germain wins Top 2, if not the best.
author: Margaret T.

description: About as close to Paris as you're going to get in SF. Great for a lunch meal, or a snack on the way home.
author: Scott D.

description: After a long night of drinking in North Beach, we ended up here to get some food in our stomachs.  I love crepes, and had wanted to try this place since I first heard about it a few weeks ago.  I ordered the savory crepe with chicken, bechamel, mushrooms, cheese, and spinach, and it was delicious.  They had a lot of other tasty-sounding options on the menu, and the sweet crepes looked good too. (I am a sucker for Nutella + banana anything.)  I don't really understand the location because it is not exactly next to the SoMa clubs (it was deserted at 1:30am on Saturday), but I heard that it gets busy during weekdays for lunch because of its proximity to FiDi.  I definitely plan to come back to try the other items on the menu.
author: Lotta A.

description: This crepe stand is bad ass!!! I stumbled across their location during a morning walk. It was perfect timing because I needed a snack. The egg, ham, and cheese filling had good flavor and just enough cheese, (it was either mozza or provolone) for each bite. The best thing about their crepes is that they use a traditional buckwheat batter for their savory options.
author: Jeffrey K.

description: I came across a catering cart for this restaurant at the SF Craft Spirits Festival (admittedly not at this specific location).  The signage referred to the crepes as being "gluten free," but when I asked an employee about the crepes, I was told they were actually a mix of wheat and buckwheat.  I assume they actually have gluten free crepes sometime and somwhere and the signage I saw was merely lazy verbage, but if you have food allergies or intolerances, please question employees carefully before eating anything based on their signage.
author: Joy -.

description: Yummy crepes with banana & nutella served until 3:30am. What more can you ask for on a Friday or Saturday night?
author: Erin C.

description: Perfect crepe? ABSOLUTELY. The crepes were deliciously perfect in every way. Hot, crispy, light, soft exterior, filled with yummy goodness! The best midnight snack.
author: Gene L.

description:
Creperie Saint Germain is okay.  For a food cart with low overheard $7.95 for my crepe was way too much $$$.  If I go to subway, I can get a full meal with chips and a drink for $1-$2 less than this.  I also can get a sit down meal at a cheap Thai restauraunt like King of Thai noodles for the same price.  It also took forever to wait for my food.  I purposely went late hoping to miss out on the crowds and there wasn't a line when I went up to make my order.  However, there was a long line for those who had already ordered and paid.  There were only two people who worked there.  The person taking orders also doubled up making crepes in between taking orders.  There was only one full time person on the crepe line, but I don't think they could fit another person in the cart.  I could see they were scrambling to get the crepes out. My wait was 15-20 minutes for my single crepe.  There were about ten other crepes ahead of me.  If you are expecting something fast and cheap this is not your place.

The crepe itself was okay.  I had crepe #14 with bacon, mushroom, creme fraiche, and cheese.  It sounds like it would be super yummy and that's what I was going for, but I didn't see any creme fraiche and it was a little bland.  Also, it wasn't served hot.  I might be back, but not on a regular basis.  I probably will go back soon to try the sweet crepe, but maybe at 3:00 so hopefully the employees will not be overwhelmed.
author: Dbear T.

description: My friend ordered # 8.Béchamel Grilled Chicken with Mushroom, Cheese, Tomato, Spinach and found pieces of bone in her crepe. I ordered # 13.Smoked Turkey, Cheddar, Caramelized Onion, Crème Fraîche, Mushroom, I asked for chicken instead of turkey and I was charged an extra dollar, my crepe was jammed packed with cold, soggy mushrooms and barely any chicken. The flavor of it turned my stomach, I ended up vomitting from it and threw it away.
author: Vanessa N.

description: Had a nutella and banana crepe. Tasty, but not the light and fluffy crepe I dream of.
author: Jack K.

description:
Just had lunch there today.  This is my third visit. The first time I went it was good, the second time very good,  todays crepe was poor.  It had WAAAY too much butter.  I feel sick and my shirt is a mess from the butter dripping down the bottom of the crepe holder onto my shirt
Nice flavors and combinations but $7 to $8 for a crepe is no deal
author: TJ D.

description: Picked up a turkey and cranberry crepe on the way to work for breakfast. Solid, hefty portion size. Was great but not amazing - hard for me to put a finger on why.. just seemed to lack a little bit of flavor (maybe not enough salt?). Would try it again though at any rate.
author: Gary Y.

description:
going for a honey, banana, & almonds this morning since I have cash on hand! i've never been on the savory side

the buckwheat crepe is crisp on the edges and soft is the center. the ingredients are fresh and plentiful. this is definitely a place i would treat myself to when i have some cash on hand.
author: Marjie T.

description: The best crepe I have had so far. I love it that you can make your own crepe and it is quite hearty. Be prepared to wait if you happen to go right in the middle of lunch rush. But so worth the wait!
author: Kanwal A.

description: I am a french citizen and grew up with crepes. I tried a ham and cheese crepe tonight at Saint Germain and it was as good as it gets. Very simple setting (a cart on the sidewalk) but excellent food. It was well worth the wait.
author: bora o.

description: Had the salmon crepe here which cost just under $8. I was pretty surprised by the portion served to me. (It was almost the same size as the 12 inch plate it was served on)  It was perfectly simple and delish. Will need to try their other savory crepes. It's so good to see more affordable food options in SOMA other than $5 Indian lunch at Mehfil.
author: She R. A.

description:
came across this place on my way to the bank.  decided after i made my deposit i'd come back to try a crepe.  with only six bucks in my pocket, i was only able to afford one crepe on the menu, which is a bit much if you ask me, it's a crepe.  especially if you're serving the crepes outside in a parking lot from a truck window.  
as for the crepe i could order, it was a basic cheese and egg crepe.  mediocre at best.  maybe all the good reviews are from the crepes with more filling to them, but it was just cheese and egg wrapped in a TOO THICK crepe.  i could only finish half of the crepe before i had to compost it.  it was unable to stomach it.  there was no flavor to the crepe, it really tasted like a plain flat waffle.  don't get me wrong, i love waffles, with blueberries and syrup on top.
author: Boho H.

description: "WOOHOO! AS GOOD AS IT GETS!" How nice that able to find this place, well, actually it's a food stand right next to the club Temple. Tried # 3, egg, cheese with turkey. hummm.... Yummy, yummy, happy, happy. Oh yeah, next time wanna some dessert with ice cream... Haven't had any food stand for a while. Food stand on the street is always something warm my heart in a special way, just like a kid is having some ice cream from the local ice cream van parked right in front your house. Anyway, people! Go try it!
author: Flora F.

description: Would really have to be hungry to stop here again.  With all the great food in SF, I really get angry when I have a bad meal.  We stopped by here after a walk during lunch.  I got the Salmon crepe with cream cheese, capers and spinach.  My  colleague got the Tuna salad crepe.  Both were mostly inedible.  My crepe was so salty I gulped water all afternoon.  My friend's was just not tasty.  Pretty disappointing.
author: Sallye M.

description: The goat cheese, spinach and jalapeno crepe that I picked up for lunch was excellent. The crepe is made of a slightly fluffy buckwheat batter, and the rest of the ingredients are really fresh. Everything is made to order, you can customize things, and the staff is really friendly. I love places like this!
author: Rand F.

description:
just bought a chocolate infused crepe from here
and 
satisfaction coming on

de-lish-us- ness

excuse me now while i proceed into euphoric detachment..
author: Maria M.

description: Great late night crepes out of a food truck. I was staying at the St. Regis a block away and didn't feel like midnight room service for 2 for $70. Instead, walked over to this creperie stand. Fantastic!  I had the bacon egg tomato cheese. And my wife had the nutella banana strawberry. Both hit the spot. Mine was a tad shade soggier than I would have liked hence the minus one star.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Fresh ingredients, authentic crepe batter and not too much f#*?'n cheese. Only knocks,  about a 10 min wait and a bit of a drip from the bottom of the crepe.
author: JT W.

description: It's not your fault, it really isn't, ok it's a little your fault. I just keep forgetting that I hate savory crepes until I start eating them. I was left being hungry... the garbage can was full and satisfied. I'll give you an extra star because I hope that your sweet crepes, which I do like, will redeem you... but I don't plan on getting one anytime soon.
author: danny e.

description: Awesome food, friendly people.  Just discovered this place after a nasty experience trying to get a sandwich at the Roastery around the corner. Very refreshing to have fast service with a smile.  And did I say the food was awesome?
author: Tony C.

description: Very tasty crepes! The chicken, mushroom and béchamel crepe was delicious and filling. I'll be back soon to try one of the dessert crepes!
author: Adam B.

description: I kept walking by this place on my way from my office to a client site and meant to try it after seeing small crowds huddled around it near lunch hour. I finally got the opportunity today and was very happy with my ham, cheese & egg crepe.  An excellent sized crepe for lunch (maybe a bit big) and messy to eat so I finally understood why people stood around eating on the street as opposed to trying to eat it neatly back at the office. Good selection, I'll be back to try the dessert crepes!
author: Amy C.

description:
Best crepe I've had since I've been here. Had the raspberry jam which was just OK- maybe I should have had the banana/nutella or savory crepes. 

Then again, maybe I'm just not a crepe person. But the crepe was good, the portion large, and the lady friendly. The downside to these food carts is that there's nowhere to sit. 

Drop your business card in the candleholder and you might win a free crepe on Fridays- check their Facebook page.
author: KD D.

description: I just noticed this crepe truck around the corner from my work. I've only had one crepe from there but I thought the flavor of my actual crepe was really good. I got a ham, mushroom, egg crepe which was really delicious, the flavor of the crepe is nice and hearty and really made a nice lunch. I think the owners seem to be pretty committed to healthy and organic ingredients. I will definitely add this into my lunchtime rotation.
author: Cathy T.

description:
First off, they're now located on the corner of Howard and 2nd Street and I was sooooooo excited to see them parked there Monday am, but now I am soooooooo sad.

Went there today around 12:30 to check it out.  Not too much of a line; 6 people in front of me and maybe 10 people standing around waiting for their order.  It took a good 10 minutes to get to the front of the line to place my order, then I waited over 40 minutes for my crepe to come up and then they got it wrong, which I didn't realize until I had gotten back to work.

I have to say, my crepe was delicious even though it wasn't what I wanted and I can't imagine this place sticking around if they can't get their process moving more quickly.  In Paris, you order, 3 minutes later you have an awesome crepe in your hand for half the price.

I wanted to love this place and since it's a block from my office was looking forward to a regular crepe fix, but not after today.

Soooooo sad.
author: smrt O.

description: These aren't so much authentic crepes as they are creative and original crepes. I love the Mediterranean crepe! The crepes don't appear to be the dark buckwheat crepes you may find elsewhere however. They are lighter and fluffier.
author: Jc S.

description: This place serve the best crepe after the bars or clubs, it's right near Club Temple and Club NV. I usually order the beef crepe (Never really knew the name of it because I was too drunk) basically it's like a burrito and they only make it at night.  I do remember the nice lady or guy mentioned about they use buckwheat which is supposed to be more healthy. Anyways 2am this place definitely curve my hungry and help get me sober.
author: DVS A.

description: It's an excellent spot.  I've gone there several times, experimenting with savory crepes (favorite so far: egg, cheese, caramelized onion).
author: A S.

description: I'm not going to go so far to say my dessert crepe (bananas, honey and cinnamon) I had right before falling asleep was as good as the Ferry Corsten show that induced my ravenous hunger, but it's culinarily (sp?) close. Delicious, especially with the buckwheat batter. Were the price a bit cheaper than $6, I'd absolutely be awarding a fifth star.
author: Jason B.

description: YUM! Stopped by today to pick up a crepe for lunch.  I couldn't choose between savory or sweet so i got both! LOL.  I got the chicken, mushroom, tomato, spinach with bechamel sauce.  Sooo good and sooo huge!  I was surprised how filling it was.  I havent tried my strawberry, nutella, and banana yet but I can just imagine how good it is....i have it chilling in my fridge right now... :)
author: Jojo L.

description: If you want a healthy yet delicious crepe to go, go to this place!!!! I would recommend the Chicken crepe but they do have a nice variety of items from something sweet to a Salmon crepe. The staff, especially Ozlem, was friendly, willingly to help and give me suggestions.  I hope they will be around long enough for me to try most of the items!
author: Chris G.

description: This crepe stand rocks. I've stopped by 3 times and tried a different crepe every time. The buckwheat crepe is tasty with a savory filling and sweet. The sweet crepes are filled with fresh fruit. Not frozen. The workers are super nice and take the time to ensure a nice product. The wrapping is great when on the go.
author: kelly y.

description: Oh Creperie St. Germaine how I so wanted to love you.  And my co-workers as well.... But alas 2 weeks in a row we are disappointed and we visited 2 different locations!!!! Why do you torture us? Why does your crepe not have the ingredients we ordered? We sit at our desks working and dream of crepes and then someone makes the trek to get them and then there is the excitement when they arrive back at the office and then........ "Oh man, this is just okay" or "what is this chunky ham when we ordered bacon?" or "Hey didn't this strawberry one, uh, wasn't it supposed to have some crème or something in it?" and so, now we sit and tell stories of the crepes we have made or our mothers have made and our mother's mothers..... And we think, I guess I'll just make crepes at home from now on or just go to Galette 88 where they don't skimp on ingredients. Sorry Creperie St. Germaine, I thought we had something.
author: Sarah M.

description: The food is good, my only complaints are the parking, the wait and that they only take cash!  Its definitely worth trying though, lots of choices.
author: Sherry Z.

description: I was so excited when this cart showed up a few blocks from my old office.  Thank God for something DIFFERENT to eat for lunch!  I'm partial to the savory crepes, particularly the spinach, cheese & mushroom.  The only negative is that the lunch lines can be long and slow.
author: Lulu B.

description: I'm generally not a big fan of crepes, but this is one of the only places open in SOMA/Financial District on a weekend night so I finally gave in.  I'm so glad I did, because their crepes are unlike any I've ever had before!  I have gone by numerous times since, and find myself craving them all the time.  My favorites are the mediterranean and the strawberries with creme fraiche - sooooooooo good.  They clearly use high quality ingredients here, and put a lot of thought in to their ingredient combinations.  My only complaint is that they're not open during dinner time.  I would totally eat their savory crepes for dinner!
author: Holly S.

description: The crêpes are decent, however the operation is unsanitary. The cook handled everyone's cash between frying up the crêpes and hand sprinkling the ingredients on them - no handwashing or gloves in sight.
author: David B.

description: Tasty, fast and open late! This mobile creperie was a pleasant find when I went out with friends one late Friday night in SOMA. I've only tried the nutella crepe, which was delicious, but can't wait to try more.
author: Gina K.

description: i had the ratatouille and it was obsolutely delicious!! a flavourful and hearty crepe. the ingredients worked very well together! i'm especially impressed that the ingredients perfectly evenly spread over the crepe so you get the same juicy flavorful bite up to the last bite!
author: Amy W.

description: it was great!! i was leaving the EVE lounge after the thursday night party (PST).  i saw this crepe spot and wanted to check it out. they didn't take debit cards and all i had was $9. the bill came up to $13 and they said dont worry about it. two fat ass crepes for $9.  tasted like heaven
author: Fatherhood T.

description: Came here today for lunch after looking at all the yummy pictures here in Yelp.  I got the chicken, tomato, and spinach.  It was really good!  The crape came out to be soft, with crispy edges.  It was done just right, not soggy or hard like some other crape place.  I am definitely coming back to try the others. It was difinitely worth the 5 blocks to get here.
author: Venisa S.

description: these guys rock! you will love the different choices they have for everyone! when i need food on the run this place has it! i go there and try something new each time, they have a way of putting things into crepes that just taste great! the Mediterranean is my favorite!
author: daniel l.

description: generally okay stuff, but the spinach mushroom and cheese crepe was cold in the middle - the mushrooms and onions never had a chance to warm up - and that was disappointing. maybe throw it in the microwave for 30 seconds to get it up to temperature?
author: Wangston P.
